resources.string: If you are finishing the current training, no data will be saved for this training. Finish anyway?
You have successfully completed this training session. Do you want to start a new session?
There is no data for this exercise. To view a statistic, you must finish at least one unit of this exercise.
PPD - Points per dart\nShows all time average points you scored per dart.
PPTD - Points per three darts\nShows all time average points you scored with three darts.
COR % - Checkout rate\nShows all time checkout rate in percentage.
Darts\nAll time thrown darts in X01 exercises.
60+\nShows all time three dart score count, between 60 and 100 points
100+\nShows all time three dart score count, between 101 and 140 points
140+\nShows all time three dart score count, between 141 and 177 points.
Avg. Score - Average Highscore result\nShows the average result for all Highscore excercises.
Darts\nAll time thrown darts in Highscore exercises.
Hits - Average hits count\nShows the all time average hit count
Hits % - Hit rate\nShows all time hit rate in percentage.
Score - Average score\nShows the all time average score.
Single - Single count\nShows the all time single hit score.
Score - Double count\nShows the all time double hit score.
Score - Triple cout\nShows the all time triple hit score.
In the current version, the game mode is limited to X01 single-in double-out.
In the current version, statistics are not yet differentiated by target numbers. That is why unfortunately no selection of the target is available yet.
Choose the target for the exercise
Choose your start value for this exercise
Did you know that there is also a dartboard with quadro fields? There is another ring on this board. This is four times the value.
Martin Petrov, threw in 137.1 hours, divided into 6 days, a total of 1,000,001 points.
In 1937, 300,000 players wanted to participate in a city tournament in London.
Phil Taylor has won most World Championship titles so far. He earned 16 titles, 14 of them in the PDC and 2 in the BDO.
Ricky Evans threw the fastest 180 on Live TV. For that he only needed 2.13 seconds.
An arrow must not be longer than 30.5 centimeters. The maximum weight of an arrow may be 50 grams.
